task-wr.title: Configuring Controller-0 for a Titanium Server Secondary Region
task-wr.shortdesc: You must configure controller-0 for the Secondary Region as detailed in these instructions.

prereq.p: For controller-0 configuration, you require the following:

li.p: optionally, a CA-signed digital certificate to support HTTPS access for REST API

prereq.p: Before installing the ISO image, ensure the following:

li.p: The host meets the hardware requirements for a controller. For more information, see Titanium Server Installation: Hardware Requirements.
You have terminal-server access to the host, so that you can monitor messages during initialization.
The PXE boot, management, infrastructure, OAM, and board management networks are planned, set up, and connected. For more information, see .
All other hosts in the Titanium Server Secondary Region are powered off.
You have reviewed the Release Notes for any additional information pertaining to installation.

step.cmd: Prepare a bootable USB flash drive to use for installation.
Copy all additional required files to a second USB drive.

info.p: A license file and a region_config file are required during installation and configuration.

step.cmd: Copy the additional required files to the controller-0 hard disk.

info.p: Connect the second USB flash drive and mount it, and then copy the license file and the region_config file to the controller hard disk. The recommended location is /home/wrsroot.

step.cmd: Apply any patches that may be needed. For more information, see Titanium Server Patching and Upgrading Platform Software.
Configure controller-0 as a Titanium Server Secondary Region controller.

info.p: where region_config_path is the full path to the region_config file. The default value is /home/wrsroot/region_config.

step.cmd: Wait for the Linux prompt to return with no errors.

note.p: After this step, there are no further region-specific changes.

step.cmd: Delete the region_config file from the system.

note.p: The region_config file contains clear-text authentication data. For improved security, delete this file from the system immediately after use.

postreq.p: To continue the installation and configuration of controller-1, storage nodes, and compute hosts, refer to the Titanium Server installation guide that pertains to your system, either Titanium Server Installation for Systems with Controller Storage or Titanium Server Installation for Systems with Dedicated Storage.
